column4: hi all, I need to install apache but I dont want it to run by default, only when I start it manually, what is the best method to change autostart behavior?
you can set apache to only run a limited amount of processes and increase that if it's actually working.. if you don't find how to only start it when you want to that might be one solution
The problem is that I wont be using apache for days, and it will be consuming memory and boot time, so I want just not to start it ever.
I'm not sure if you'll actually notice apache if you limit it... but you can always stop it with "sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 stop"
